decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively reduce the opponent's life total through a combination of cheap and efficient burn spells, alongside aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Delver of Secrets, and Stormchaser Mage. The deck also includes various cantrips and card draw spells to help maintain card advantage and find the needed spells to close out the game. Additionally, disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Daze are included to protect the deck's game plan and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands and spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up a powerful win condition. It heavily relies on cards like Crop Rotation, Exploration, and Life from the Loam to manipulate lands and generate card advantage. The main win condition is to assemble the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo, creating a 20/20 Marit Lage token. Additionally, it has removal options with Punishing Fire and disruption with Wasteland and Rishadan Port to keep the opponent off balance. The deck aims to grind out victories through resource denial and inevitability.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to play powerful artifacts and creatures that disrupt your opponent's game plan while applying pressure on the board. With cards like Metalworker and Grim Monolith, you can generate a lot of mana early on to play threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. Using cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere, you can slow down your opponent's plays while setting up your own win condition with cards like Blightsteel Colossus and Sundering Titan. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with powerful artifacts and creatures, ultimately leading to victory.

The key idea of this Grixis Aggro deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a mix of cheap and efficient spells, accompanied by aggressive creatures like Young Pyromancer and True-Name Nemesis. By utilizing cards like Wasteland and Daze to disrupt your opponent's mana base, combined with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will to control the game, this deck aims to quickly close out games through a combination of direct damage and creature pressure. The deck also features versatile creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Gurmag Angler to provide additional threats and utility.

The main focus of this deck is to deal direct damage as quickly as possible to the opponent by using burn spells and aggressive creatures. The deck utilizes efficient spells like Lava Spike, Rift Bolt, and Lightning Bolt to chip away at the opponent's life total, while also taking advantage of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Monastery Swiftspear to pressure the opponent. With a low mana curve and high damage potential, the deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through aggressive plays while also maintaining control with disruptive creatures and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down your opponent's plays, while also utilizing cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Swords to Plowshares to gain an advantage, this deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats. Overall, the key strategy is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while applying pressure and maintaining tempo.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Cloudposts and Eldrazi Temples to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, Kozilek, and Emrakul. Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void disrupt the opponent's plays, while Sorcerous Spyglass helps to shut down key cards. All Is Dust can clear the board, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provides additional removal. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with huge threats while controlling the board and mana advantage. It combines ramp and control elements to create a dominant late-game presence that is difficult to overcome.

This deck focuses on early aggression and disruption, relying on low-cost spells and efficient creatures to quickly pressure the opponent. Using cards like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage as quickly as possible. With a mix of counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Wasteland, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and allow for consistent plays throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quick, aggressive plays using cheap spells and efficient creatures. It aims to control the game early on with counterspells and disruption, while putting pressure on the opponent with creatures like Delver of Secrets and Nimble Mongoose. It also uses Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base and keep them off balance. Overall, the key strategy is to maintain tempo and board control, while steadily chipping away at the opponent's life total with a mix of direct damage spells and evasive creatures.

The main focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to disrupt and control the opponent while applying pressure with efficient creatures. Using a combination of counterspells, removal, and creature threats, the deck aims to quickly establish board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. By utilizing a mix of disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will alongside aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, the deck aims to consistently apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Legacy Elves deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Heritage Druid and Gaea's Cradle, while using creatures like Nettle Sentinel and Quirion Ranger to generate additional mana. The deck aims to draw through the deck quickly with Glimpse of Nature, before using Natural Order to search for Craterhoof Behemoth for a game-ending attack. Additionally, the deck includes utility creatures like Reclamation Sage and Elvish Visionary for support. The strategy revolves around creating a large board state and overwhelming the opponent with a massive amount of creatures.

This deck aims to quickly build up storm count by casting a series of cheap spells such as Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual, before finishing off with Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens for a massive amount of damage. The key strategy is to generate enough mana and draw through the deck efficiently using cantrips like Ponder and Preordain to find the necessary combo pieces. Discard spells like Duress and Cabal Therapy help disrupt the opponent's game plan while protecting your own combo. Finally, Past in Flames allows for a second chance at casting spells from the graveyard for a lethal storm turn.

This deck revolves around cheating powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. The strategy is to get these creatures on the battlefield as quickly as possible to overwhelm the opponent and win the game. The deck also includes a number of counterspells and card draw spells to protect the combo and ensure consistency in executing the game plan. Additionally, Cunning Wish provides access to a sideboard filled with versatile cards that can help in various situations.

This Merfolk deck focuses on early aggression and disruption, using cards like Cursecatcher and Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponents while quickly building a board presence with Aether Vial and lords like Master of the Pearl Trident and Lord of Atlantis. True-Name Nemesis provides a difficult-to-answer threat, while Phantasmal Image allows for flexibility and copying powerful creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with evasive creatures and tribal synergies, backed up by disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its game plan.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo - Storm deck aims to quickly build up mana using rituals and cantrips, leading to a powerful finish with Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens. The deck utilizes cards like Infernal Tutor and Ad Nauseam to find key combo pieces, while also disrupting the opponent with discard spells like Duress and Cabal Therapy. The deck is designed to storm off and win the game in a single turn, leveraging fast mana acceleration and card draw to create a critical mass of spells for a lethal storm count.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively by utilizing low-cost spells to control the board and deal damage quickly. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Lightning Bolt, while also generating value through cards like Young Pyromancer and Delver of Secrets. The deck utilizes a combination of counterspells, removal, and card selection to stay ahead of the opponent and maintain board presence. Additionally, the deck employs a mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland to hinder the opponent's mana development.
